title: Engineering Skills Retention Guide
summary: Comprehensive guide on what engineers learn in college vs what they retain, including year-by-year breakdown, MATLAB explanation, and a self-test framework for evaluating engineering thinking skills
key_points: Engineers retain problem-solving frameworks more than specific technical details
MATLAB is a matrix-based programming environment for engineering simulations and computations
Key retained skills: breaking complex problems down, math modeling, using tools, design tradeoffs
Provides a 5-lens engineering check framework for self-testing
Year-by-year engineering curriculum breakdown from freshman to senior
hooks: Engineers don't retain every detail - here's what actually sticks
5-lens framework to test your engineering thinking
MATLAB: The calculator × spreadsheet × programming language hybrid
quotable_moments: Engineers don't retain every detail. What sticks is: How to break complex problems into solvable chunks
Think of MATLAB as a mix of: Calculator × Spreadsheet × Programming Language
You are my engineering coach. Help me stress-test the idea below through five lenses
review_notes: High-quality educational content with practical self-assessment framework. Well-structured with clear year-by-year progression and actionable testing methodology.
